title: Riot covering up posts.
body:
Someone just posted a  person who had probably botted all the way to B5 by int feeding, Tele fixed the post to remove the name and shame, and then went and removed the post entirely because he wasn't getting the reception Rito wanted.

Good showing riot.

replies.body:
Hey Valor,

As you know naming and shaming is against the rules.

I can see why you’re frustrated in this scenario. We aren’t looking to censor anyone, especially if there is feedback for Riot. 

We want the boards to be a place about discussion and shared interest in league of legends. Not a place where we just hate on others. There are other avenues to report players such as player support and the end of game lobby.

If you want to have a discussion about behaviour or systems, make it an image and as untraceable as possible to illustrate your point. But please do not just straight up post a player's info or start a discussion to hate on a player, that’s not what the boards are for.

http://imgur.com/a/vzZ3f

As soon as threads start to become witch hunts instead of discussions we will look to delete the thread or comments in the thread.

In this scenario we overreacted as after the clean up of the image players were still pointing out that it was easy to find the accused player. So we deleted it. In retrospect it would have been better to simply remove the identifying information and delete the specific comments rather than the whole discussion.

In future we will be extra careful not to delete a good discussion topic when there are comments witch hunting a player. But we also ask you all to help do a better job of using a clean image to make a point vs directly naming or linking to any players profiles.
So in other words, go the way of WW2, censor it all and send a letter covered in black lines.

Hey Mods

You dont have defend or apologise for your actions in this regard. The community stands behind you and we are thankful for the actions of Seph and Tele in upholding the rules and defending the integrity of the forum.

They were concerned about the content and direction of a thread, and acted diligently and responsibly to negate it.

I trust them to do it again.

If there was anything worthwhile to contribute then nothing is preventing that contribution from being reposted in a new thread albeit with an increased sensitivity towards the forum rules. But obviously, and considering who the participants were, it was just a hate fest.

So uhh, why do mods like tele - Seph etc.
Can act as a tribunal to remove posts (I actually think that post didn't need to be removed it was already edited.)

But we can't have an actual tribunal. *huehuehu*

To be clear, I was the one who edited and re-posted the image. I really didn't want to outright censor something that important. I felt the community needed to know what was going on.

We definitely messed up after that when we removed the post though. 100% our fault and we're sorry if that means anything.

I know, I was making a joke (Trying too) out of a somewhat serious situation.

I just thought it was... strange.
That we have a tribunal for boards but not an actual tribunal XD

(Which funny enough, would actually fix these "OMG INT FEEDERS" N shit)

Allow me to step in here.

Tele was not the user who removed the post, I was.

This was done as tele had failed to remove details in the post that were being used to discern who the user in question that was being reported was. one user was even suggesting a way to work out who the user that was botting was. This is not something that we want on the boards. Witch hunting is **NOT** acceptable.

So go ahead and delete any post with any frustration made to a player like this.

THIS IS NOT THE FIRST TIME THIS WOULD BE AN ISSUE AND YOU HAVE BEEN TOLD BEFORE.

Posts only get removed when they act against the set rules.

You should probably go read what they are before you bitch and moan about something that's against the rules being deleted.

Naming and shaming is against the rules, this is the rule that was used to delete the post after it was censored by tele, and the reasoning is "they can use op.gg" so basically any complaint post has to be deleted in this case, meaning this is direct censorship and needs to be discussed.

>so basically any complaint post has to be deleted in this case

Not so, just the ones that provide enough information to result in a "witch hunt" scenario. You can complain about a particular player all you want, just don't mention their name or which champion they were using and you should be fine (probably also avoid putting up too many of their stats from the game). No one is "censoring", just making sure that the "name and shame" policy can't be abused by simply providing information other than the players summoner name.

Riot games logic

Its ok to int feed ruining hundreds of games.

Its not ok to call out people on this bullshit to warn and prevent other players having to deal with said player

Genius.
implying that riot endorse inting dude haha !!!

I can shitpost on forums all the time but complaint posts that could be led back to the person being complained about (see every one of these posts cuz op.gg exists) will be removed for "witch hunt" rules. Nice meme boards Riot, witch hunting should be allowed anyway lmao. If people let words effect them (whether they are guilty or innocent) they are mentally weak retards who deserve it.

While its true that having some thick skin is a good thing.
It doesn't mean that words are weak, nor are the people affected by them.

You referenced WWII before, if you want to go that angle then remember that the Nazi's rose to power with words alone, before even a single shot was fired. They may not break your bones, but words can do a lot of damage. 

Witch hunting is just punishing negativity with negativity, based on nothing more than a single poster's say-so. Its bullying at its most fundamental. 
Is that really the community you want to be part of?

Targeting individuals for their wrong-doings accomplishes nothing.

Rather than attacking and witch-hunting individual players who misbehave, we need to solve the problem at its root.
Cut down one weed, and another shall rise to take its place, nothing changes... 
But replace the type of soil you have, and you get rid of all the weeds once and for all.

This is why Riot implements player behaviour systems, not to punish individuals for their wrong-doings, but to dissuade other players from doing wrong in the first place. 

__________

Remember, Batman isn't effective because he catches all the criminals _(he doesn't, it's not possible to catch everyone)_, he is effective only because he makes himself a symbol, and fear of that symbol dissuades would-be criminals from committing the crime. 
he doesn't and couldn't go round witch-hunting every criminal.

A witch hunt is vengeance, not problem solving.

Nice overly dramatic blogpost fam but cyberbullying isnt real unless the person receiving it lets it be real. And ideally the more toxic the community the better for me 
{{champion:29}}

Well I mean cyberbullying can be serious... but with how often the term is flung about it's often not really. 

There are things that can be done that are very serious forms of harassment, mostly with defamation, photoshop and personal attack that can ruin someones life, but on the other hand accusing someone of botting (whilst I do feel name and shame on the boards is a complete waste of time and effort) doesn't really have the same gravity does it?

I do think such posts are useless though and should be removed but not because it's witch hunting but more because it's pointless and a bit rude to the individuals selected out.

Also this isn't me picking on people who claim cyber bullying, it's me picking on how the term cyberbullying is brandied about and people who try to use it as an absolute, because it completely undermines the gravity of when a case of bullying is serious.

I'll tell you what I've noticed a lot this season (took a break for 6 months). The amount of absolute newbies. I'm not talking about your average bronze 5 player, I'm talking about your average level 1 player - IN RANKED! That's right, the number of people that have bought a level 30 account this season to jump straight into ranked is astounding!

How do I know? Well for a start, these players don't farm AT ALL. I'm not talking about 30cs at 10 minutes, I'm talking 10 cs at 20 minutes!
They also walk around aimlessly as adcs and attack the first target they see. They have no clue how to build. In one of my recent games we had a Sivir in the mid lane with courage of the colossus mastery and built tank items. It was by a great fluke (no, not skill) that our team won the game.

These players don't even know how to communicate with the team by even typing or pinging. These players don't have a prior seasons history on op.gg. They don't have proper runes or masteries set up. And they know nothing about the game.

I guess when you can just buy a level 30 account for $10 at sites like PA (that's right its not naming or shaming, its a pseudonym - don't remove this post), and there's over 500 accounts to choose from in the oce region you know that a couple of things haven't happened.

1. Bots are not being killed fast enough (hire someone to do it!).

2. Account trading sites that display full summoner names are not being shut down properly (hire a person!).

3. Matchmaking is pathetic. I've been a silver support main the past couple of seasons and placed 2-8 in placements = Bronze 5. Climbed to bronze 4. And now its 50% win 50% lose, depending on these newbies in games. And it seems to me that although the opposition sometimes get these newbies also, that more of the time our team has them (would say 80% of the time). Is that Riot's way of saying that you have to carry because you have silver mmr, even though you are a support main?

4. Boosted bonobos haven't returned to their rightful levels. So many Gold 5 players that are absolute trash, like worse than your average bronze 3 player. How I know? I'm a former analyst for OOL and OCS teams. So don't criticise my rank, mechanics have nothing to do with my understanding of the game. I guess this is because its going to take a long time for these boosted bonobos to calm down from their dynamic queue boost.

HOW TO FIX THIS?

Hire someone to activity be paid that goes around nuking bots for one, closing accounts that are in the process or being sold secondly, and deleting those int feeders from the game. It's not hard to find this sort of behaviour out there, as it's far too common.
